title: Cecilia Joytwin
author: Cecilia Joytwin
content: What are the things needed to know here as a newbie?

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: As per the forum the first thing to do is to familiarize your self with the forum's rules and regulations so as not to make any error that might affect your account in the long run. Here's the link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0And also if you intend on learning about Bitcoin and cryptocurrency then you can use the following link:Beginners & Help Encyclopediahttps://www.bitcoin.com/get-startedhttps://coindesk.com/learnhttps://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chaptershttps://theinternetofmoney.infoBy the way welcome to BTCtalk.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: This would be a short and good advice for newbie:1. Don't plagiarism and always write the original source.2. Choose Bitcoin and avoid the rest coins including ETH, BNB, etc.2. Buy a hardware wallet e.g. Trezor or ledger, write down your seed phrase.4. Never expose your identity and your wealth.5. Use decentralized exchange e.g. Bisq and avoid any centralized exchanges e.g. Binance, Kucoin, Coinbase etc.6. Never do this: lend your coins, stake your coins and send to ponzi scheme site.I believe you will never get scammed and your coins will always safe in your side, also you will survive in this forum.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Don't spam and don't plagiarize. Remember those two, then you're pretty much good.But most importantly, know the industry.* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://cryptosec.info* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters* https://github.com/ethereumbook/ethereumbook#chapters

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: All the things you need to know as a newbie has already been posted, you just need the guidance to find it and the patience and interest to actually read them.All the threads suggested above (and those still to come below) would be useless to you if you do not read them. Making the effort to read and learn would set you apart from almost 95% of newbies here.Use the Search option effectively to find posts/replies relevant to what you want to know.Also, avoid information overload. You can not go through the tens of threads in a day or two. Pace yourself, and learn at your convenience.This is a fun forum; Enjoy it!!

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Many links have been given you, but let me add, make sure you go beyond this forum, read news and crypto related articles too. Do not fear to bring discussion up on this forum, if you do not understand something very well, ask memebers on this forum that will have idea. Be careful of altcoins, some are good but most are bad, the coin that you can have trust in is bitcoin because it is decentralized. Do not save coin on exchanges, go for self custody, cold wallet is safest. Do not rush, take it easy and learn.

comments.author: Rruchi man
comments.body: Quote from: Cecilia Joytwin on December 30, 2022, 07:14:12 AMWhat are the things needed to know here as a newbie?I am happy to Welcome you here OP. Apart from the regular advice, I'd add that you should not be under any form of pressure to impress, just be yourself, be original and constructive, so we can benefit from the originality that you will bring in terms of your perspective, opinions and views.Engage in discussions and conversations that you are comfortable with, not all discussions need your input.Try to exhaustive in expressing yourself, this is a forum to learn and everyone leans better with key details than summary.Mark the day you joined on your calendar, develop consistency here (be more consistent here than you are on social media platforms), and in no time, you will be amazed at your growth in terms of your knowledge.I hope to see you grow in rank.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: OP, welcome to the forum. You have been given a lot of good advice as well as links for review. But first, as everywhere else, when you arrive at a new place, you just need to look around. Don't be too quick with information; we've all been in your position as newbies. Be sedate, read, and ask questions you might not understand. You are in a very friendly community that is always ready to help.If you are really interested in Bitcoin, do not give up, here, like nowhere else on the Internet, you can get a lot of information, in a language that is understandable to you. So just be curious.I wish you good luck.
